name: Radiation-Induced Brachial Plexopathy with Paraneoplastic Features
chief_complaint: Severe burning pain and weakness in my right arm, along with twitching muscles
symptoms: Electric shock-like pain in C8-T1 distribution
physical_findings: Positive Tinel's sign at supraclavicular fossa
prognosis: Guarded - 60% progress to complete paralysis within 2 years despite treatment
description: A rare delayed complication of mantle radiation for Hodgkin's lymphoma (typically 10-20 years post-treatment) with superimposed paraneoplastic neurological syndrome. Features both radiation fibrosis and immune-mediated neuronal damage, creating a dual pathology that's exceptionally challenging to treat.
risk_factors: Underlying occult small cell lung cancer
multiple_choice: Radiation-Induced Brachial Plexopathy with Paraneoplastic Features
